title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for equation of f(1)

1 point is earned for 1 = 1 + k + p

1 point is earned for 0 = 2 + k

1 point is earned for solution of system

For continuity at x = 1,

lim x→ 1 − ( 2x− x 2 )=f( 1 )= lim x→ 1 + ( x 2 +kx+p ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@591E@

Therefore 1 = 1 + k + p

Since f is continuous at x = 1 and is piecewise polynomial, left and right derivatives exist.

f − ' (1)=0 and  f + ' (1)=2+k MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzamaaDa aaleaacqGHsislaeaacaGGNaaaaOGaaiikaiaaigdacaGGPaGaeyyp a0JaaGimaiaabccacaqGHbGaaeOBaiaabsgacaqGGaGaamOzamaaDa aaleaacqGHRaWkaeaacaGGNaaaaOGaaiikaiaaigdacaGGPaGaeyyp a0JaaGOmaiabgUcaRiaadUgaaaa@48DD@

For differentiability at x = 1, 0 = 2 + k.

Therefore k = −2, p = 2.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for correct f' and analysis of sign of f' on domain

1 point is earned for (−∞,∞)

f′(x) = 2 − 2x, x ≤ 1

2 − 2x > 0

x < 1

f′(x) = 2x − 2, x > 1

2x − 2 > 0

x > 1

Since f increases on each of (−∞,1) and (1,∞) and is continuous at x = 1, f is increasing on (−∞,∞).
descriptions:

1 point is earned for correct f' and analysis of sign of f' on domain

1 point is earned for (−∞,∞)

x > 1

Since f increases on each of (−∞,1) and (1,∞) and is continuous at x = 1, f is increasing on (−∞,∞).

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for f''

1 point is earned for noting sign changes in f'' or change of concavity in f

1 point is earned for ordered pair (or equivalent)

f''(x) = −2, x < 1

f''(x) = 2, x > 1

Since f''(x) < 0 on (−∞,1) and

f''(x) > 0 on (1,∞) and

f(1) is defined,

(1, f(1)) = (1, 1)​ is a point of inflection.
